subject: Business
title: The Containerization Revolution
description: Learn The Containerization Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: Before 1956, loading a ship took weeks. Longshoremen carried cargo piece by piece. Then the shipping container arrived.

buildup.text: Malcom McLean invented the standardized container: a metal box that fits on ships, trains, and trucks interchangeably.

discovery.text: Loading time dropped from days to hours. Shipping costs fell 90%. Global trade became economically viable.

twist.text: The container didn't just change shipping. It enabled globalization. Manufacturing could now be done anywhere cheaply.

climax.text: Today, 90% of world trade moves in containers. The humble metal box reshaped the global economy.

punchline.text: The most transformative invention in trade isn't a technology. It's a box.
